intro: Lactuca scariola var. dubia, commonly known as the rough lettuce or wild lettuce, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. It has a long flowering period, often from late spring to early autumn. The leaves are edible and have a slightly bitter taste, though the plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
